values:
I've had a lot of time to myself at work here lately.  Last four hours of my shift are usually kind of slow, and there's not really much I can do except for zonk out on the internet and reflect on my life.  So I thought I'd share some things in a nice little "I'm still here" post.

For the past few months, I've been a hermit.  I've been an ass.  I've been a horrible friend.  These past few months, I have been so caught up in my own self pity/loathing that I've neglected many of you that I call "friend" or "family".  I haven't been true to myself, and I know that some of you look at me now and say "Who the hell are you?  I don't know you anymore..."

And I would like to take the time now to say "I'm sorry".  I'm sorry for being as antisocial as I am.  I'm sorry for not being there when you needed me.  And most of all, I'm sorry for being such a downer when I have been there.  If I've wronged you, pissed you off, or disappointed you, then here is a mass-apology.  Expect a more personal one in the very near future.

I'm still not 100%.  I still have very low self-esteem, and I'm still slightly depressed.  I'm trying to fix both of those issues, but it's taking a little more work than I care to admit.  Just bear with me a little bit longer, and I'll be back to the annoying SOB that you all know and love (or hate...whatever your preference)

Again, I'm sorry, and I love you all.  Peace.

Yes, I've been invisible for over a month.  I apologize for that.  I've had a lot of shite on my plate, and I'm not even halfway through it yet.

I'm finally taking my leap of faith in a few months.  I'm going to quit my job, and try to find something to make myself happy...or at least happier than I am right now.  I'll be back in the Mayfield area toward the end of January, if all goes right.  Fingers crossed...

Just a little "Irvan is still alive" post.  Later peoples.

1. Do you have a tattoo?
2. How old are you?
3. Are you single or taken?
4. Fish?
5. Do you dream in colour?
6. Ever seen a corpse?
7. How about them hipsters?
8. How did we meet?
9. What's your philosophy on life and death?
10. If you could do anything with me, and have no one know, what would it be?
11. Do you trust the police?
12. Do you like musicals?
13. What is your fondest memory of me?
14. If you could change anything about yourself what would it be?
15. Would you cheat?
16. What are you wearing?
17. Have you ever peed in a pool?
18. Would you hide evidence for me if I asked you to?
19. If I only had one day to live, what would we do together?
20. Which do you prefer - short or long hair?
21. What's your favorite day of the week?
22. What's your favorite color?
23. If you could bring back anyone that has passed, who would it be?
24. Tell me one interesting/odd fact about you?
25. What was your first impression of me?
26. Have you ever done drugs?
27. Will you post this so I can fill it out for you?

I really hate technology.  Had to get a new router tonight...old one kept dumping the connection every fifteen minutes.  Got to be a real pain in the arse when I was trying to game or chat.  So, I broke down today and bought a new one.  So far so good, after fighting with the damned thing after an hour and a half.

We'll see what happens in a couple of days.  I may wind up having to call Charter about our internet...just depends on what happens.

*insert dance of happiness here*

It's going to be a good Thanksgiving for a change...this pleases me greatly.

*insert more dancing here*

So, today ranks right up there with one of the worst days EVER!!!!

To start off, I'm getting ready to finish the laundry I started this morning.  Yes, that's right...they haven't been dried yet.  Some dumbass decided to wash and dry five loads at the same time today...as a result, I couldn't get a dryer until now.  I hate people.

Then, to make matters worse, I hit a dog on my way to work.  Little bastard just run right in front of the car, like it wasn't there.  Dog's alright, and as far as I can tell, there was just a little cosmetic damage on the car...so no big deal.  Still makes me a little late for work so I can check the damage out.

After that, I get my eyeballs screwed out at work.  Seven and a half hours of doom in my eye.  I think I spent several thousand today trying to get the damned thing to work.  They are NOT gonna be pleased with me tomorrow...

Storms are all over the place, and I'm stressed and pissed.  It's not been a good night.  I'm ready to go back to Mayfield.

Ah well, life goes on.  And so do I...gotta jet people.  Laters.

Yep.  I'm having a day.  Woohoo!  

So yeah...it's been a helluva night.  I'm about ready to scream.  I'm calming down, slowly but surely, but I fairly positive that noone wants to piss me off right now.  It would probably be a bad plan...ending with me either getting fired or being put in the hospital.  Quite possibly both.

To top it all off, I've had maybe 4 hours of sleep...woke up freaking out from some dream at about 7 this morning, and I can't even remember what it was about.  I just remember waking up, grabbing a pillow, and throwing it at my door.  Why a pillow?  My hand is on it.  Why did I throw it?  I have no friggin' clue.

My boss is trying to butter me up for some reason.  Keeps trying to get buddy buddy.  Makes me a bit suspicious.  Maybe I'm just being paranoid.

OH!  For those of you who are wondering, I'll be at game on Sunday.  Wee!  I may drive down Saturday night after I get off work...I dunno, it just depends on how I feel that day.

Blargh, that's all from me I suppose.  I just wanted to post something...my blog looks a bit empty right now.  Hope you all have a wonderful day.  Toodles.

So, I'm working fairly hard on things NOT work related right now.  Collaborating with a buddy of mine to get me website up and running...it's proving fruitful.  So if you guys ever need any kind of web design or graphic design work done, head on over to http://www.retro-pixel.com.  Mitch is awesome at what he does...take a look at his own site, and then mine if you'd like.  http://irvangaming.com

But yeah...things are going alright, I suppose.  3 day weekend!  WOOHOO!  Just a little "Irvan lives" post to brighten your day.  Later peoples!

Edit:  I want to cry...I sent Yahoo a message saying I didn't need to have my server reset anymore...turns out they didn't get the message till it was too late.  Now that whole beautiful site's gotta be redone.  *sniffle*

Next time, I'll just call and tell them *sweatdroplet*

http://www.usatoday.com/tech/gaming/2007-06-10-church-england-sony_N.htm . . .OK, to the Church of England, I would like to point something out: This is a VIDEO GAME. It is fantasy. If you look very closely, those "people" being shot are an alien lifeform that opposes you in the game. Not humans. Had there been an actual war, and some of your troops holed up in there to try and hide from enemy gunfire, they would more than likely get blown to kingdom come from enemy bombs. Seriously people...this is fantasy. If Sony didn't ask for permission to use the Manchester Church as a background/stage, then yes, there should be a formal apology, and England should get a small cut of the royalties. However, it being over 6 months after the game was released before you say anything is a little bit on the DEE DEE DEE side. If you were truly outraged at this, then you would've said something when the game first came out...not over half a year later. Moral of the story: People are stupid. End rant.

So yeah...wow.  OMG!!Con 2007 was awesome once again.  Lot's of stress, but it was well worth it.

Guests this year were Greg Ayres, Luci Christian, and Bob and Emily DeJesus, who are all wonderful people.  If you ever get the chance to meet them, you'll know what I'm talking about.

Greg DJ'ed a rave for us on Saturday...I seriously think he was trying to kill us.  It was such a blast...you know you had fun when you can barely move your legs the next night.

<lj-cut text="On a sad note...">On a sad note, though...I would like to ask for some prayers.  My nephew (godson, whatever you want to call him) is really sick.  His parents had to leave the con early on Saturday to get him to the hospital, and they airlifted him up to Louisville Saturday night.  So, if you're a religious person, please, pray for the little guy.  If not, then keep him in your thoughts.  It'd really mean a lot to me.</lj-cut>

So yeah...expect pictures coming soon.  I didn't get very many this year, cuz my camera was being stupid.  The ones I got are good ones, though...so that works.

Later peoples...I guess I should get back to work ^_^'...

Much Less than 3 ;)

Irvan

So yeah, I'm finally back home after one hell of a weekend.  It had its share of ups and downs, but overall, OMG!!Con 2007 was a blast.  If you didn't go, you should have.

I'll try to post a complete report after work.  Right now, though, I have to get my happy ass to a working.  Have a day ladies and gents :).

Someone needs to take WoW away from me for a couple of days.  Just change my password, and not tell me what it is until I get a new chapter written on me story.  WoW is taking up too much of my creative thinking time...LOL.

In other news...I may be coming home this weekend...WEE!  I'll know for sure tomorrow.

<3 you guys

OK.  So I've been doing a LOT of reading on the whole VA Tech. shootings.  It's a tragedy...at least 30 dead, including the gunman, Cho Seung-Hui.  My heart and my prayers go out to the victims, students, professors, and families out there.

<lj-cut text="That being said...">
That being said, I would like to make one point perfectly clear here.  I've been reading a lot of reports from various students, lawyers, etc., that state that violence in the media may have attributed to this atrocity.  This is, in my opinion, the biggest crock there is.

There are millions of people across the world that watch these violent and disturbing movies, that listen to these rap and heavy metal lyrics, that play Grand Theft Auto and other various violent video games.  A very small percentage of these people actually go out and commit these heinous crimes...murder, rape, thievery.  The vast majority of us have the common sense to know better.

With the exception of the news and a few "based on a true story" deals, the violence in the media is fantasy. It's make-believe.  I play various violent games.  I have yet to go out and steal a car, run over some hookers, and bust some caps...and I don't plan on ever doing it.  I use these games to let out the stress of the day...to relax.  It's recreational, it's fun.  I use music and movies in the same fashion.

All of you nay-sayers out there against violence in video games and movies, take a look at another angle.  Look at how our children are being raised today.  I was waiting in line at Wal-Mart not too long ago, when I heard a five year old kid say "Fuck you bitch, give me the candy."  I turned around and saw that the child's mother was about 22.  She did nothing about it.  Had that been me, even today, I would've gotten grounded, a spanking, and then she would've told my father, and he would have added to my punishment.  I'm not saying beat these kids, but we definetly do need to discipline them.  

Parents need to step up and take the responsibility for raising their kids.  Don't let them grow up wild.  When they do something that they aren't supposed to, explain to them the first time that it is wrong, and that we shouldn't do it.  If they continue to do whatever it is, discipline them.  Time out, spanking, grounding...all of these are acceptable forms of punishment.  Again, when I say "spanking", I don't mean beat the kid.  I mean turn them over your knee, and spank them.  One or two slaps is all that's necessary.  
</lj-cut>

Gah, got off on a bit of a tangent there.  It just so happens that this whole "let's blame violence on video games/movies/music and not on how people raise their kids" thing is a pet peeve o' mine.  Enjoy the rantings of an Irvan...Peace.

I thieved this when I was reading the livejournal of Mookie of Dominic Deegan "fame". It's a good comic...I highly recommend it. http://www.dominic-deegan.com

It seems like a good outlet for things no one knows about. That, and insomnia is a pain in the ol' arse. So it helps put me to sleep.

1 - List 20 things that you want to say to people, but never will.
2 - Don't say who they are.
3 - Please do not assume that anything is about you.
4 - If you are not 110% convinced... it's probably not you

one - You're arrogant. You're too smart for your own damn good. But I know that behind that asshole shell, you're a good guy. I'm happy I can call you family.

two - Don't worry about me. I'm a big kid now.

three - Take care of yourself. Everything else will be taken care of in it's own time. 

four - Nice guys finish last because they usually have no confidence. It's the ones that have a backbone that you have to watch out for, assholes.

five - Look, for once in my life, there's very little drama. I'd like to keep it that way. Stop fuckin' around with my family, dammit.

six - Look. Things didn't work out between us. I told you I would like to remain your friend. Stop being such a bitch and talk to me.

seven - Mate, while you were a good friend back in the day, you really screwed up things between us when you started the creepy bit. Dubya Tee Eff.

eight - Sometimes, I wish I'd never opened up at all.

nine - You're giving me a headache. Cheer up emo kid.

ten - I really don't care what you say or think about me. I'm doing something for me for a change. If you don't like it, piss off. I don't need you.

eleven - There are so many things I wish I could say to you right now. I guess I'll never get that chance.

twelve - Dude, that little bit o' optimism that you keep throwing out really keeps me going. You don't know it, but you've really helped me with things. Thanks.

thirteen - STOP GROWING UP! YOU MAKE ME FEEL OLD!

fourteen - You need to take care of some rather important matters in your life before I can work with you.

fifteen - I hate to say I told you so, but . . .

sixteen - You don't need pills. You don't need alcohol. The only thing that can make you happy is you. Get over it.

seventeen - Do whatever it is that makes you happy. As long as I can see a smile on your face, I'm content with life.

eighteen - I'm sorry I've been such an ass here lately. As soon as I get things settled, I'm taking you all out to dinner, whether you like it or not.

nineteen - How do I say this? Even with things done anonymously, I can't say what's truly on my mind.

twenty - I don't know you. You don't know me. All I have to say is, remember: She's one of my girls. She calls me crying because of something you've done, and there will be Hell to pay. There is no place you can hide, and noone that will be able to help you. Please bear that in mind.

And I'm still WIDE awake. Dammit.

My boss is a friggin' moron.  That is all.

~ So I got my vacation next week.  Hallelujah.  5 day weekend for the win...and I get paid for three of those days.  Happiness :).

~ Coming home again this weekend...I hope to see some of you for a few minutes at least...it would be nice.

~ Ghost Rider for the win, by the way.  Nicolas Cage pulled it off...I was pleasantly surprised.

~ I've decided that the C-Shift Tireroom/Stock Prep electricians up here are assholes...and we're proud of it.  I'll give more details when I get home.  It was definetly good times, though :).

~ Apparently everyone is amused by the fact that I wore a Thundercats shirt to work today.  People keep on giving the call when I walk by.  Oh well...THUNDERCATS, HO!

~ As soon as I get back down to Paducah and get my thumb drive back, I need to get back to work on me story.  I'd like to have more than just a stinkin' prologue.

~ GARAM GREMLINS NEED TO LEAVE ME ALONE!!!!  I JUST WANT TO SURF THE INTERNET!  GRAH!
</lj-cut>

That is all

So I would like to reiterate the fact that I hate people.  People are stupid.  Sometimes, I just wanna go out and raise the average IQ of the area by getting rid of a few people.  

<lj-cut text="Explanation:">
So my little rant last night prompted me to explain myself today.  Last night, during what was an easy night at work, I got thrown on a machine for 3 hours.  Normally, this wouldn't bother me so much.  However, this machine was broke because of the stupidity of some idiot operator that didn't want to work.  He goes and scratches a lens on a photoeye, which in turn causes it not to "see" anymore.  Normally, this isn't an issue.

However, this was a photoeye we don't keep in stock.  As a matter of fact, the computer, when I ask where it is, pretty much tells me "What the hell is this?".  So I go searching for a suitable replacement.  Get three of the them out there, wire them up one at a time...none of them work.

Three.  Hours.  Because of people not wanting to do their job.  

Also...for those of you that think this "I hate people" thing is me being anti-social...I leave you with this.  Yes, I hate people.  The general population in the Mount Vernon area has the IQ of a lemming.  But persons, I can get along with.  I like persons.

/rant
</lj-cut>

You Are 30% Extrovert, 70% Introvert

You are quite reserved
You aren't afraid of social situations...
But you very much prefer to go it alone
And why not? You're your own best friend!
Are You An Extrovert or An Introvert?


 

So sleep has been fitful at best. My dreams have been effed up. In most of them, the only thing I can remember is crying three times. And I'm not talking soft little boo-hoo crying. I'm talking curled in the fetal position bawling my eyes out screaming, not being able to breathe I'm sobbing so hard. It wouldn't be so bad if I didn't feel the "pain" of it when I woke up.

Work is going...well, it's work. More overtime for me! There's at least 6 people that have either quit or been fired today alone. Makes my job a lot more miserable.

Oh yeah...and happy Single's Awareness Day a week or so early to all my homies. You guys rock :).


YAY RANDOM! ...LiveJournal hates me yet again...

So...I'm stuck in Mt. Vernon right now, because I didn't want to waste the gas to drive home for one night.  I have to be back at work tomorrow at 11 in the AM, for even more overtime of death.  So, between now and then, you know what I've been doing, aside from thinking?

Playing WoW.

I know, I haven't touched WoW in months.  But, with the new expansion out, I admit I was weak...I heard the voice of Illidan saying "You know you wanna...come play.  There's Blood Elves now...they're teh coolness...come on, play WoW...we have cookies."  So I caved, bought the expansion, and have had my soul ripped from my body once more. *sigh*

On top of that...I just got my W2 in.  I'll admit right now that I'm almost having second thoughts about going back to school.  Cuz I mean...wow.  Just...wow.  Tha's a nice income.  Plus, I have an opportunity to make even more money.  I'd have to go back to working weekends, but I think I can manage that.  I dunno...I'd have to talk it over with my boss.  I'm going to discuss it with him, at least.

Meh...I'll reflect on it more whilst I game.  You kids have fun now.

Later.

Irvan

Idealistic and thoughtful, you have the mind and ideas to change the world.
And you have the charisma of a great leader, even if you don't always use it!

The purpose of your life: saying truths that other people dare not say

Famous purples include: Mahatma Gandhi, Martin Luther King, Jr., Susan B. Anthony

What Color Is Your Aura?


i'm going to bed...

i want to go home...

I don't pimp this thing out nearly enough, but I need to.

I've just recently gotten the itch to start writing again.  My brick wall came crumbling down, and inspiration has hit like a freight train.  So, here's what I would like from all of you...

Would you critique my work?  I would honestly like my friend's opinions on this...even the opinions of total strangers would be nice.  All I ask is that you check it out, and then either post a comment here, or send me a message, or something.  I really don't care.  I'd just like to know what people think, good or bad...

Thanks!  Here's a link to the prologue of said story...enjoy: http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/46950791/

-Irvan

Ladies (and gentlemen, if you happen to have the answer for it...lol), I just have have one quick question to ask you...

Why the hell are women attracted to assholes, dickheads, and just overall bastards?  I'd really like to know.  Because for the most part (there are always exceptions...), every time that I personally show interest in someone, they've got their heads stuck up some bastard's ass.

I'm sorry...I know it appears that I am jealous of these individuals.  I, am fact, am not.  I happen to like being the nice guy...except for the fact that I'm completely ignored on the dating scene.  And why is that?  Because I'm (usually) the nice guy.  I try my damnedest to not treat a lady like property or shit.  Apparently, that's what's hot these days.

I'm not the best looking guy in the world.  I'm not hideous, but I know I'm not the best looking.  And I'm not the richest guy there is...I do well for myself, but I'm definitely not swimming through a personal vault full of treasure and riches in Duckburg, if ya know what I mean.  But I'm a nice guy.  I can (and do) treat a lady with respect and as an equal.  I'm not a sex hungry maniac like most guys appear to be (especially the assholes in question...)...overall, I don't think I'm that bad of a catch.  I'd just like to know how it is that I'm always hitting these damned dry dating spells, and Captain Does-Nothing-To-Better-His-Life the Pothead, with his mighty "Women are Property that I can do Whatever I Want to With" hammer manages to get a date every single time.

I just...I dunno.  It baffles me.  It makes the brain hurt.

I'm going to bed now.  It's nearly 2 in the AM.  And I'm tired.  Later peoples.

I hate that episode of Full Metal Alchemist.  I like Maes Hughes...he was teh awesome...

Sorry...randomness.  I felt like posting, and that's what is on my mind right now...lol.

Merry Christmas all.

-Irvan

OK, so it's not the most original idea, but it's still a good one.  And it really makes you think...

As we all know, it's that time of year where we reflect on the things we are thankful for...enclosed is a short list all the things I'm thankful for, be they good or bad.

<lj-cut text="I'm thankful for...">I'm thankful for...

- serving a God that can guide me through the darkest of times.

- having a family that loves me, no matter what I do.

- having the friends that I have.  The ones that have held me when I was bawling my eyes out, and didn't know what to do.

- being with, and losing, someone that I cared about deeply.  Losing her opened my eyes to so many things about me, and it is slowly making me a better person.

- the people that come to my door crying.  Every one of you who have called me at 3 in the morning over your life's troubles, with or without tears, you reminded me of why I'm here.  I thank you for that.

- having a job.  Despite the fact that I complain about it constantly, it could be much worse.  I could be unemployed, and in deep shite.

- for all of you that I don't consider "friends", but family.  Though we don't have the ties of blood, I still consider you to be as close as my own brother and sister.  I love you, and you know who you are.</lj-cut>

And there we have it, my un-original list.  Bwhahaha.  Much less than three you guys, and I hope you all have a Happy Thanksgiving.

I'm bored.

Therefore, I post.

My apartment is quite silent.  I expected my roommate to be playing Final Fantasy XII when I got in.  The loser isn't even home...and he took the PS2 with him.  Sad day...lol

Had fun this weekend...despite getting lost in Nashville.  Note to self...I-24 leads straight to Hickory Hollow Mall.  Remember that.  And did you guys know there's a building that looks like Batman in downtown Nashville?

*sigh* so Starr threw me under the truck in game last night...thanks Starr.  I needed that big ol' Semi in my face.  Appreciate the status and all...but did you have to volunteer me for Sherriff :P.

Tralalala...so I think I'm done with the being random and such.  I think I'ma go pop a movie in and chill for a while.

Later peoples ^^

-Irvan

<lj-cut text="so I post random Irvan thoughts!">

So, I've been settling in, getting used to working this 3-11 shift.  And getting my ass handed to me whilst I'm at it...lol.  Jeebus...I don't think I've had this many new problems bite me in the ass all at once before.

But eh...that's not what's really keeping me awake.  To tell the truth, I don't really know what's keeping me awake at three o'clock in the morning.

Friends o' mine are in town.  I'm hoping I'll get to hang out with them some this weekend...I haven't seen them in a few months.  And Cody is coming back this month, as well.  She'll be in town Tuesday...I is happy :).  Planning on maybe trying to take her and a coupla others out to Nashville or something.  I dunno.  We'll see.

The emo-ness has been trying to sneaks it way back into my life.  I keep it at bay with a good healthy dose of Final Fantasy XII in my life.  It's a gorgeous game, though it does take a little getting used to.  I strongly recommend it.

No...I catch myself every now and again wishing that things had worked out differently over the past few months.  I still wonder what might have been...but eh, I don't let it bother nearly as much now.  Life happens...you just have to deal with it and move on.

Wow...we're bouncing all over the place here, aren't we?  OMG!Con 2007 is practically right around the corner...I can't wait.  I'm supposed to be assistant manager of the security staff...ought to be fun, eh?  Here's hoping I get to do "Whose Line is it Anime?" again...that was fun :).  *insert geek glasses and otaku kanji here*

Meh...I'm done rambling.  Hope I haven't confused too many of you.  Have a day peoples...hopefully, I'll see some of you tomorrow night.</lj-cut>

Toodles!

<lj-cut text="Hey look! I can copy and paste!">
So, I haven't written anything here in a while now.  Figured now was as good a time as any, seeing as I've come to an important decision in my life.

I'm leaving Continental Tire.  I'm coming back to the Mayfield area, and I'm going to start going back to college.  I want to get my Bachelor's degree...I'm thinking I'll get it in Computer Science.

As such...I've bought a laptop.  It should be here in a couple of days.  I will be selling my lovely desktop.  If ou or someone you know is interested, gimme a call or drop me an email, and we'll talk.  I may have given one or two of you a price on it already...sorry, but that price won't cut it anymore.  I'm going to take the best offer...I know how much I want for it, but I also have a decent idea of what I'll get for it.

Computer has a completely legal copy of Windows XP Home on it...a DVD+/-RW with Dual Layer capability...a 52x CD-ROM, Sound Blaster X-Fi sound system...which has DD surround sound capability.  Intel Celeron 2.66 GHz processor and will have 1 GB of RAM, once I find what I did with that other stick...it currently has 768 MB of RAM, and can hold up to 2 gigs.  2 40 GB hard drives, and a ATI All-in-Wonder 9600 series vid card round out most of the hardware specs.  Included with the compy will be a wireless keyboard and mouse, monitor, and a set o' speakers.

Software wise, I'm not really going to leave a whole lot on here.  OpenOffice.org, AVG, Mozilla Firefox, World of WarCraft, Nero, and Guild Wars are all I really plan to leave on it once I sell it.  Most everything else is going to be transfered to the portable.  Also, I'll leave the PC-link that I bought for the 360 in the deal, so that you won't have any trouble transferring files and such over.

And I've totally made this blog an advertisement...moving on...

Some of you are probably wondering why in the world I would want to quit such a good paying job to go back to school.  After all, I make $20+ an hour, not counting overtime, and it's full time work.  The answer is quite simple, really.  No matter how much money I might be pulling in, I'm not happy.

I never see my family.  I rarely see my friends.  I have to drive 2 hours to see anybody that I consider a loved one.  The job in and of itself, is horrible.  When you can see the anklets on the cleaning crew, you know things are bad.  I work OUTRAGEOUS amounts of OT, and things are just steadily going downhill for that company.  It's not a good work environment, and I just don't want a part of it anymore.

So here's what I'm doing.  Next time I'm in Paducah, I'm opening a savings account.  I'm putting a selected amount o' mula in said account every week, in order to build up some reserves.  If anyone catches me withdrawing from this account, except in EXTREME emergencies, I give them full permission to beat some sense into me. 

As soon as I hear back from MSU, I'm going to start looking for work in that area for sometime around July or August.  By then, I hope to give CTNA a swift kick in the ass and a friendly bird as I walk out the door.  I'll also be looking for an apartment on the cheap, or quite possibly be looking into moving into the dorms. 

And, most importantly of all, I'm going to be happy.  No more of this emo BS.  I'm going to get my life in order, spend time with my friends and family, and smile.  A lot.  You people will just have to get used to that.


So yeah...end rant.  I guess I wanted to make this one count.  See you guys soon!  Much less than three you guys ^_^</lj-cut>

So Trinity Blood rocks out pretty hard core.  I strongly suggest it to anyone with an interest in Hellsing.

Two months, and she's still pretty unhappy with me.  Safe to assume I'm free to play the field then, I would say.  Thoughts?

<lj-cut text="Read more here...">So I got a phone call from a dear friend of mine that I hadn't talked to in forever, Nicole.  Her husband has recently joined the military, and she was basically just calling to catch up and fill me in on his progress.  She also just happens to be a good friend of Laura, whom I was dating until just a couple of months ago.

We caught up, told some stories, shared a few laughs.  Then I asked how Laura had been.  She hadn't returned any calls or e-mails, so in the typical Irvan fashion, I thought that there was a good chance she still didn't want to talk to me.  Nicole's response: "Yep, she's still pretty pissed at you."  I knew she was upset with me...didn't realize she was pissed.  Either way...if she still doesn't want to talk to me after two months, I'd say it's a safe bet that we're officially single, right?

I dunno...I really wish she would just come out and say "Hey, jackass...get over it...we're through" or even "Fuck off, you slack jawed junk slut".  Hell, even a simple "Piss off" would work.  I would at least like to talk it out...get the closure.  Not have this "Let's just not talk about it" bullshit.  

Blargh...I just dunno anymore.  I know that I'm going to start dating again.  I'm tired of moping around the apartment, being lonely, and having nothing to do and noone to talk to.  I need to get on with my life, and that's what I'm going to do.</lj-cut>

Above you'll see a little bit of ranting from the Irvan...it felt good to get it out in the open.  

If things work out the way I want them to, I'll be at the From Dusk till Dawn game in Paducah Sunday.  I may not stay for the whole thing, being as I work 12 hours Sunday morning, but I'll be there for the most part.  Hope to see you guys there.  Should be lots and lots of rampant violence and destruction :).

Yay for ranting after work...off to the bed place for me!  Tra la la~

OK, so I checked out this website called My Heritage.com. It's fairly interesting...I suggest you check it out. Apparently, I look like Christopher Lee in the face...*ROFLCOPTOR!!!* Anywho...coming home Thursday afternoon...hope to see some of you lovely peoples there...toodles.

Dirge of Cerebrus FTW you guys.  Ya'll don't even know.

Going to game Sunday.  I miss hangin with the gamers.

And I'm probably going to do something really stupid as well this weekend.  So forgive me if I disappear for a while.  I promise I shall return!

*sigh*

Because it crossed my mind today...for some reason.  It happens when I think a lot.

Ladies, here's a revelation for you.  Something I feel should be shared with the world...particularly the people who feel the opposite of what I'm saying.

<lj-cut text="Here it is">NOT ALL MEN ARE IN IT FOR THE SEX!  There are some of us...rare as we may seem to be, who are looking to find that right girl, someone who is compatible physically, emotionally, and mentally.  Please don't generalize and say that all men want is sex.  When you do, you really piss off the few "good guys" that there are...and we don't forget it very easily.</lj-cut>

*sigh* Sorry folks...had to get that outta my system.  It's just something that crossed my mind on the way home today.  Hoorah 2 hour road trips!

I'ma go lie down before work...later peoples!

So I didn't go home yestersday.  Didn't feel like driving two hours when I wouldn't be able to hang out with everyone.  Maybe next week.

Instead, I've been geeking out at the apartment.  Bought the WoW d20 handbook, and seasons one and two of Knight Rider.  I want my own K.I.T.T.  That car is teh roxxors.

Anywho...toodles...
